intro: Dodecastigma mazarunense, commonly known as the Mazarunense dodecastigma, is a rare flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its bell-shaped blue or purple flowers. The plant has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and thrives in rocky, well-drained soils. It is adapted to the arid climate of its native habitat and is often found in coastal areas. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
